009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
016import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
017import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
018
019import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
020
021
022/**
023 * This plugin shows a trick how to automatically load some pre-defined sample
024 * image in the case that no other image is currently open. It works by defining
025 * a non-empty constructor which is invoked BEFORE ImageJ handles all the rest.
026 * All the remaining parts of the plugin remain unchanged.
027 * If the specified sample image is not of the proper type is will still be
028 * opened but the problem is subsequently detected by the setup() method.
029 */
030public class Open_Sample_Image_For_PlugInFilter implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
031        
032        /**
033         * Trick, using the (normally empty) constructor to check if a suitable image is
034         * already open or not, BEFORE ImageJ's internal machinery jumps in. In this
035         * case we open an image from an internal resource, but any other action could
036         * be performed. If this is not needed, just remove the constructor or make sure
037         * a suitable image is always open. The constructor must be public.
038         */
039        public Open_Sample_Image_For_PlugInFilter() {
040                if (noCurrentImage()) {
041                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.MapleLeafSmall);
042                }
043        }
044        
045        private ImagePlus im;
046
047        @Override
048        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
049                this.im = im;
050                return DOES_8G;
051        }
052
053        @Override
054        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
055                if (im != null) {
056                        IJ.log("processing " + im.getTitle());
057                }
058        }
059        
060}
